thread.title: Georgia interim bulldog mascot to be named Uga X on Nov. 21
thread.title_full: Georgia interim bulldog mascot to be named Uga X on Nov. 21 | savannahnow.com

author: DispatchDaemon
title: Georgia interim bulldog mascot to be named Uga X on Nov. 21
text:
Photos Back | Next Charles Seiler sits inside Uga's doghouse with Que, the grandson of Uga IX, during a lightning delay in the second half of the game between Georgia and Louisiana Monroe on Saturday, Sept. 5, 2015, in Athens, Ga. (AJ Reynolds/Staff, @ajreynoldsphoto) AJ Reynolds/OnlineAthens.com & Athens Banner-Herald Back | Next FILE - In this Oct. 3, 2015, file photo, Georgia mascot "Que" tries to stay dry in his doghouse during an NCAA college football game against Alabama in Athens, Ga. Georgia's new bulldog mascot has passed his audition and finally earned an official title. "Que" who has serves as the replacement for Uga IX this season, will be formally named Uga X at the Georgia home game against Georgia Southern on Nov. 21. (AP Photo/Brett Davis, File) From Staff and Wire Reports
ATHENS — Georgia’s new bulldog mascot has passed his audition and finally earned an official title.
“Que,” who has served as the unofficial replacement for Uga IX this season, will be formally named Uga X at Georgia’s home game against Georgia Southern on Nov. 21.
Que is replacing his grandfather, 11-year-old “Russ,” who worked 25 games as an interim mascot from 2009-12 and then 38 games as the official mascot from 2012-14. Russ compiled a record of 44-19.
“Uga is cherished by University of Georgia fans worldwide,” said UGA president Jere Morehead. “We are grateful for Russ’ dedicated service, and we look forward to welcoming Que as our new mascot.”
The 1-year-old Que made his debut as mascot in Georgia’s preseason picture day for fans, making his rise to official status only a formality.
Frank “Sonny” Seiler’s family, based in Savannah, has bred the line of English bulldog mascots since Uga I made his debut in 1956.
